poem:
Title: "Silence in the Courtroom"

Trump declared
he was muzzled,
Yet willingly chose silence 
in the grand court spectacle.
Once a raucous crow,
he settles on
the defense perch, still.

Without fanfare, claims of victimhood
fade into the sallow morning. 
Rarely do accused tongues tie themselves -
A surprising spectacle of willful quiet. 
Like a lone, empty crate
on the hush-hush trial stage.
